name: Dramba
info: All but dust spells are ranged.

style.name: Corn Dust Shower
style.short-description: Target ignores 1 point of damage from next 3 attacks
style.description: The protection expires after one scene (or day) if unused.

style.name: Brick Dust Circle
style.short-description: +2 to your magic defense die size until you are forced to re-cast
style.description: If you move outside of the circle, you lose the bonus (and you must have broken style, since none of the Dramba spells grant movement).

style.name: Hex Eye
style.short-description: Target takes Magic penalty die on all defenses next round
style.description: The target rolls his own Magic die (not yours) as a penalty die on all defense rolls (physcial, magical, or social) next round.

style.name: Burn Doll
style.short-description: Remove one magic, disease, poison or similar eÂ‡ect applied within last 3 rounds
style.description: The cleansing fire removes almost any negative magic, poison, or alchemical effect from a person, as long as that effect originated within the last 4 rounds. Against a magic effect, you must win a Magic vs. Magic roll. For poisons and alchemy, roll your Magic die against the static Quality of the poison or alchemical substance.

style.name: Cloud Eye
style.short-description: Target cannot see you next round
style.description: If an opponent who cannot see you attempts to attack you, he does so as if blinded (p. 29; 4 die size penalty to attack rolls, minimum d2).

style.name: Salve Doll
style.short-description: +2 to any characteristic harmed within last 3 rounds
style.description: This heals up to 2 points of characteristic damage, but they must have been inflicted within the last four rounds. Thus, if you begin the Dedicate Doll > Bless Doll > Salve Doll sequence immediately after an ally is injured, your Salve Doll is effective, but with a delay of even one round the sequence culminates too late.

style.name: Body Switch
style.short-description: Switch bodies with target (next round only) Rebalance actions only
style.description:
Each creature retains its own mind but gains the physical characteristics of the other's body (Strength, Quickness, Body). Attempting to directly damage the host body is psychologically difficult and requires a Reason roll against the Doom.
In any case, only re-balancing maneuvers and generic maneuvers are possible. Both of you are spellbound for the round in which your bodies are switched.

style.name: Anoint Doll
style.short-description: Target uses caster's magic die as bonus die for 2 rolls next round

style.name: Dedicate Doll
style.description: You dedicate a doll to a particular target. If you want to switch targets, you must re-dedicate the doll.

style.name: Dedicate Doll
style.description: You dedicate a doll to a particular target. If you want to switch targets, you must re-dedicate the doll.
